body_html:
The idea of reusing a name_scope is a bit strange, because every op in the graph has to have a unique name anyway in the end. So you're only pushing back where the suffix will be added, it will go at the end od the op-name instead of the scope name. You're aware of that, right? I just want to make sure that that's really the goal you want to achieve.

If that's the goal, then you can do this with variable_scope and its .original_name_scope property.

# First time just open variable_scope.
with tf.variable_scope("test") as scope:
  # do things, name_scope = "test"
  ...
# Next time open name_scope with scope.original_name_scope.
with tf.name_scope(scope.original_name_scope):
   # we're back in the name_scope as before

Does that help?
